meanings.definition: superlative form of jive, meaning the most lively or energetic
meanings.sent1: The dance party was the jiviest event of the year.
meanings.sent2: She always brings the jiviest energy to the room.
meanings.sent3: The jiviest puppy in the litter was bouncing around with joy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the jiviest melody in the room.
meanings.sent5: The jiviest colors of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues.

meanings.definition: a person or thing that is the most lively or energetic
meanings.sent1: The little girl was the jiviest dancer at the recital.
meanings.sent2: The puppy was the jiviest in the litter, always full of energy.
meanings.sent3: The jiviest squirrel in the park was running around in circles.
meanings.sent4: The jiviest flower in the garden stood out with its bright colors.
meanings.sent5: The jiviest student in the class was always eager to participate.

meanings.definition: to engage in lively or energetic behavior
meanings.sent1: They jiviest when the music starts playing.
meanings.sent2: We always jiviest at family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The kids jiviest around the playground, full of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The birds jiviest in the trees, chirping happily.
meanings.sent5: The waves jiviest along the shore, dancing with the wind.
